subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Camilo Villegas, coming off a tie for third last week that allowed him to advance in the PGA Tour playoffs, made eight birdies on the long, soft Bellerive Country Club course for a five-under-par 65 that gave him a one-shot lead in the first round of the BMW Championship in St. Louis. Steve Stricker made a 35-foot birdie putt on No. 18 for a four-under 66, tied with Kenny Perry, Tim Herron, Stuart Appleby and Andres Romero. ¶The father of the 17-year-old professional golfer Tadd Fujikawa was charged with trafficking methamphetamine and awaits trial next month. Derrick Fujikawa, 44, was named in an indictment returned July 31 by a Honolulu grand jury, according to a document released by the city prosecutor’s office. It said he distributed one-eighth of an ounce or more of meth Sept. 24 and Oct. 4. If convicted on the two first-degree charges he could face up to 40 years in prison. meth ¶Peter Tomasulo, Chris Stroud, Brian Stuard and Jonathan Fricke had holes in one in the second round of the Utah Championship, the first time in Nationwide Tour history that there had been four aces in a round. Four aces were made on the same day — and the same hole — in the 1989 United States Open at Oak Hill. aces.
